##Loading the data
There are packages for loading data. Our data will either be an Excel file or a comma-separated values (.csv) file.

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(tsibble)
urlfile="https://https://raw.githubusercontent.com/flynnecon/datavizf24/refs/heads/main/online_monthly_R.csv"
```
#Getting the data read into R and then made into our time series analysis format. Note we do not need a training or test data division with the fact we are looking at a forecast 1 period ahead.
```{r  data work}
data <- read_csv(url(urlfile))
data <- data[-c(1)]
data$month <- seq(as.Date("2018-06-01"), as.Date("2024-07-01"), by="1 month")
data_tsbl <- data |> mutate(date=yearmonth(month)) |> as_tsibble(index=date)
```
```{r scatter}
data_tsbl |> ggplot(aes(x=date,y=Handle)) + geom_point()
```
